data.title: Bill Ford is doubling down on Ford shares, and quietly amassing more control of his grandfather's company in the process
data.description: The decision to purchase the shares bucks a recent trend by CEOs and corporate insiders that have sold a record $69 billion in stock in 2021.

data.title: JPMorgan Chase is set to report fourth-quarter earnings – here’s what the Street expects
data.description: Analysts have pointed to a lending rebound in the fourth quarter, driven by demand from corporations and credit card borrowers.

data.title: What Delta Air Lines predicts for business travel after the omicron variant
data.description: Delta Air Lines expects corporate clients to be back in the spring at a level of recovery similar to right before the new Covid variant omicron hit travel.

data.title: Microsoft hires law firm to review sexual harassment policies, with report due in the spring
data.description: The report will include summarized findings of a decades-old probe involving Bill Gates, after years of concerns regarding handling of harassment cases.

data.title: Two of Sen. Kyrsten Sinema's former aides have lobbied for corporate giants looking to influence Joe Biden's agenda
data.description: Two of Sen. Kyrsten Sinema's former aides have become key aides for corporate giants looking to impact President Joe Biden's agenda.

data.title: UBS says a big earnings beat and rebound may be ahead for stocks
data.description: UBS projects a solid fourth-quarter earnings season for corporate America.

data.title: Microsoft should sell Office and Windows to boost cloud business, former executive says
data.description: Productivity software and operating systems are lucrative for Microsoft, but a former executive said keeping them in house could hurt its growing cloud unit.

data.title: Who's to blame for inflation? It's complicated
data.description: President Joe Biden and other politicians will tell you inflation is Corporate America's fault. Corporate America blames the administration's pandemic assistance programs for putting too much cash into the economy.

data.author: Ritesh Kanodia
data.title: GST Input Tax Credit Changes Will Hurt Corporate Cash Flow
data.description: GST Input Tax Credit Changes Will Hurt Corporate Cash Flow

data.title: Big Tech could brush off rate hikes. Startups may struggle
data.description: Apple, Microsoft, SoFi and Coinbase all sold off sharply this week, as investors, anticipating higher interest rates, dumped tech stocks and bought shares of companies they believed were undervalued.
